talk.author: did:plc:vgqqzp55lyo3stg572yrxsz4
talk.utter: He's filing based on a business address *he* has in Texas, therefore it calls for diversity jurisdiction. Yeah, he's venue shopping because he knows that he's likely going to get his ass kicked at the trial level, but then he will appeal to the Fifth Cir.; only the 11th has more Trump appointees.

talk.author: did:plc:vgqqzp55lyo3stg572yrxsz4
talk.utter: You know what? Nevermind... on second read, this is cringey mansplainy... apologies.

talk.author: did:plc:g6asx7scljsgdu3vqwtyfszj
talk.utter: You're all good! Honestly, if he had argued that, he would have maybe at least been able to maintain a straight face. At least until the Court got to the forum selection clause in the TOS.

talk.author: did:plc:vgqqzp55lyo3stg572yrxsz4
talk.utter: Good Lord, I suspected his pleading was going to be weird, but I didn't honestly expect it to be incompetent... is he picking up lawyers left over from Trumpland?
